summary: Realistically at least one of the de Rolo children will be a tiefling, if not because of  Percy’s contract with Ipkesh then...
body:
Realistically at least one of the de Rolo children will be a tiefling, if not because of  Percy’s contract with Ipkesh then because I find impossible to believe that at least 3 different de Rolos throughout history didn’t make deals with various devils.

Percy will also have anticipated and prepared for this inevitability by making fireproof blankets and earplugs in preparation for thaumaturgy crying.

I love you.

I CALLED THE APRON A SMOCK HSKDJFSDKJ
summary: Listen to me Yeza Brenatto is an awkward disaster halfling man who loves his wife with his whole heart and you cannot tell me...
body:
Listen to me Yeza Brenatto is an awkward disaster halfling man who loves his wife with his whole heart and you cannot tell me otherwise

(aka a snippet of a critical role fic long in the works)

There’s a slow set of footsteps, then Yeza pokes his head out of the kitchen. He blinks up at Caleb, still for a moment, before recognition lights clearly in his eyes, and a half-smile crawls over his face. “You must be Caleb Widogast, then?”

He proffers his hand, and Nott buries a snort in her elbow, because his hands are filthy with flour and grain up to his elbow, but before Yeza can pull back with familiar flushed cheeks Caleb shakes his hand.

“That is me, ja,” he says. “Yeza, then? Yeza Brenatto? It is good to see you well.”

“Thank you,” he says, dusting his hands belatedly off on his apron. He’d been so excited to put it back on. It’s the little things, Nott knows; the little comforts that are strongest. The smell of honey and cinnamon, a brush of hair a familiar shade. The scent of woodsmoke. “I’m sorry I wasn’t more…” he gestures vaguely with the end of his apron. “Present, I suppose.”

Caleb waves his words away. “It is no fault of yours. To be imprisoned for so long, it is no easy thing.”

Yeza laughs. “Not for most of us, anyway,” he says ruefully, and elbows Nott. “My wife, though. Tough cookie, huh?”

question: ♫+Yasha :D
answer:
The first song that comes to mind for her, and the first i put on my playlist is “Atlas: Anger” by Sleeping at Last. (Lyrics)

Okey so, the title might seem obvious, but the text actually fits so well!

So does the vibe tbh, I like how it slowly builds, and the fast violins (I think) that are continuously playing in the background show her struggle with her emotions, but there are quiet, gentle moments in it to.

(I´ve been following your liveblog, and what comes now goes into pretty hard spoilers-territory for you, so proceed with caution)

I think that the first two verses really show the differences of her “Rage” in comparison to Grog, who always happily raged. For Yasha, it’s something that she still isn’t completely used to, and that she only lets out when nothing else seems to work, and that seems to be slowly building over time:

“Like wildfire
It starts in my chest
The silence grows louder
Ringing out in my head
I feel the Earth shaking under my feet
I feel the pressure building until I can’t breathe
And it takes everything
And it all spills out”

The “I couldn’t make it right” shows that while she now has her power, it doesn´t grant her a way to bring Zuala back, her regrets about running away, leaving her behind.

“Sooner or later the fire dies down
I’ll open up my eyes”
reminds me of her shot in the intro, that often gets linked in theories to the months she doesn’t remember, which might be a represal of trauma until she’s ready to deal with it, and connects nicely with the
“It’s fight or flight
Buried in my mind
It’s fight or flight
It keeps my mind cold”
in the next verse.

“And I’ll try and find the image of God
In mountains made of ash and clouds of smoke”
is obviously her finding, or being found, by the stormlord, same goes with the
“But I feel it break
With just one misstep down a fire escape
And suddenly I’m someone that prays”
in the next verse.

She often leaves the nein to search for answers and follow the signs of her god, so
“But I’ll leave behind miles and miles of jagged lines
Upon the surface of the Divine
I wish I could set them straight”

fits that super well, the last line reminiscent of Zuala again, she’ll always grief for her, and maybe hopes that following her god where he wants her to be gives her a closer connection to Zuala, or forgiveness for her fleeing.

The change from “I’ll open up my eyes” to “And I’ll open my eyes again” in the very last line is her getting close to Molly, and after losing him, getting closer to the nein, still remembering Zuala, still grieving her, still full of regrets, but ready to connect with people again, and, looking at Ashley’s playlist-description, maybe even fall in love again.

Wow this got uhhhh. long.

The first song that comes to mind for her, and the first i put on my playlist is “Atlas: Anger” by Sleeping at Last. (Lyrics)

Okey so, the title might seem obvious, but the text actually fits so well!

So does the vibe tbh, I like how it slowly builds, and the fast violins (I think) that are continuously playing in the background show her struggle with her emotions, but there are quiet, gentle moments in it to.

(I´ve been following your liveblog, and what comes now goes into pretty hard spoilers-territory for you, so proceed with caution)

I think that the first two verses really show the differences of her “Rage” in comparison to Grog, who always happily raged. For Yasha, it’s something that she still isn’t completely used to, and that she only lets out when nothing else seems to work, and that seems to be slowly building over time:

“Like wildfire
It starts in my chest
The silence grows louder
Ringing out in my head
I feel the Earth shaking under my feet
I feel the pressure building until I can’t breathe
And it takes everything
And it all spills out”

The “I couldn’t make it right” shows that while she now has her power, it doesn´t grant her a way to bring Zuala back, her regrets about running away, leaving her behind.

“Sooner or later the fire dies down
I’ll open up my eyes”
reminds me of her shot in the intro, that often gets linked in theories to the months she doesn’t remember, which might be a represal of trauma until she’s ready to deal with it, and connects nicely with the
“It’s fight or flight
Buried in my mind
It’s fight or flight
It keeps my mind cold”
in the next verse.

“And I’ll try and find the image of God
In mountains made of ash and clouds of smoke”
is obviously her finding, or being found, by the stormlord, same goes with the
“But I feel it break
With just one misstep down a fire escape
And suddenly I’m someone that prays”
in the next verse.

She often leaves the nein to search for answers and follow the signs of her god, so
“But I’ll leave behind miles and miles of jagged lines
Upon the surface of the Divine
I wish I could set them straight”

fits that super well, the last line reminiscent of Zuala again, she’ll always grief for her, and maybe hopes that following her god where he wants her to be gives her a closer connection to Zuala, or forgiveness for her fleeing.

The change from “I’ll open up my eyes” to “And I’ll open my eyes again” in the very last line is her getting close to Molly, and after losing him, getting closer to the nein, still remembering Zuala, still grieving her, still full of regrets, but ready to connect with people again, and, looking at Ashley’s playlist-description, maybe even fall in love again.

Wow this got uhhhh. long.

For Yasha, it’s something that she still isn’t completely used to, and that she only lets out when nothing else seems to work, and that seems to be slowly building over time:

Wow this got uhhhh. long.
